tournament.name: Weekly Duel Commander - Academia de Jogos

decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and efficient mana ramp. Maelstrom Wanderer serves as the commander, providing value by cascading into impactful spells. The deck includes a mix of board wipes like Jokulhaups and Wildfire, along with extra turn spells such as Walk the Aeons and Temporal Manipulation to stay ahead in the game. The mana base is designed to support the high mana cost spells, with a variety of dual lands and mana rocks. Additionally, powerful planeswalkers like Ugin and Tamiyo provide additional control and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents while setting up for a game-winning play.

The deck revolves around using Vendilion Clique as the commander to control the game. It utilizes a high number of counterspells, card draw, and bounce spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own game plan. The deck aims to maintain control of the board, counter threats, and generate card advantage through drawing cards and manipulating the opponent's library. It also includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through strategic control and manipulation of the battlefield.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through a variety of counterspells, card draw, and manipulation of the opponent's resources. The deck is built around Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander, leveraging his abilities to provide card advantage and graveyard recursion. With a plethora of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command, along with card draw options such as Deep Analysis and Fact or Fiction, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation to further dominate the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting opponents and overwhelming them with powerful control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large number of creature tokens and then use them in combination with powerful support cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Craterhoof Behemoth, the deck aims to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn and secure a victory. Additionally, the inclusion of combo pieces such as Ashnod's Altar and Goblin Bombardment allows for additional win conditions and flexibility in finishing off the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of ramp and card draw spells to ensure consistency and maintain a fast pace throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Karador, Ghost Chieftain's ability to cast creatures from the graveyard to create powerful combos and overwhelming board presence. With a mix of mana dorks, tutors, and utility creatures, the deck is designed to efficiently fill the graveyard while ramping up mana and controlling the board with removal spells. The deck also includes a range of combo pieces such as Phyrexian Devourer and Triskelion, as well as ways to search for and recur key cards like Birthing Pod and Reveillark. By leveraging the graveyard as a resource and assembling powerful combos, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of removal spells and strong creatures led by Obzedat, Ghost Council. The deck contains a wide variety of removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares, Damnation, and Toxic Deluge to handle threats from the opponent. In addition to removal, there are also disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. The deck includes efficient card draw options like Phyrexian Arena and Sign in Blood to ensure a steady stream of resources. Overall, the strategy involves disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence with Obzedat and other powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Teferi, Temporal Archmage as the commander to create combos and control the game with various counterspells, bounce spells, and extra turn cards. The deck focuses on generating a lot of mana with cards like High Tide and artifacts such as Basalt Monolith and Worn Powerstone. It aims to lock down the opponent's resources with cards like Stasis and Winter Orb while using Teferi's abilities to untap mana sources and control the board. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to help maintain control and generate advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck is focused on utilizing Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of different mana costs to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a high number of threats. The deck includes a wide variety of mana dorks and powerful creatures to ensure a steady stream of threats at every stage of the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful utility lands and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. The goal of this deck is to establish board dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game, leveraging Yisan's ability to adapt to any situation and constantly present new challenges for the opponent to deal with.
